ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: By working together, how well are these partners able to identify new and creative ways to solve problems?
Notes: 1 = Extremely well; 2 = Very well; 3 = Somewhat well; 4 = Not so well; 5 = Not well at all

ElementDescription: By working together, how well are these partners able to include the views and priorities of the people affected by the partnership's work?
Notes: 1 = Extremely well; 2 = Very well; 3 = Somewhat well; 4 = Not so well; 5 = Not well at all

ElementDescription: By working together, how well are these partners able to develop goals that are widely understood and supported among partners?
Notes: 1 = Extremely well; 2 = Very well; 3 = Somewhat well; 4 = Not so well; 5 = Not well at all

ElementDescription: By working together, how well are these partners able to identify how different services and programs in the community relate to the problems the partnership is trying to address?
Notes: 1 = Extremely well; 2 = Very well; 3 = Somewhat well; 4 = Not so well; 5 = Not well at all

ElementDescription: By working together, how well are these partners able to respond to the needs and problems of the community?
Notes: 1 = Extremely well; 2 = Very well; 3 = Somewhat well; 4 = Not so well; 5 = Not well at all

ElementDescription: By working together, how well are these partners able to implement strategies that are most likely to work in the community?
Notes: 1 = Extremely well; 2 = Very well; 3 = Somewhat well; 4 = Not so well; 5 = Not well at all

ElementDescription: By working together, how well are these partners able to obtain support from individuals and organizations in the community that can either block the partnership's plans or help move them forward?
Notes: 1 = Extremely well; 2 = Very well; 3 = Somewhat well; 4 = Not so well; 5 = Not well at all

ElementDescription: By working together, how well are these partners able to carry out comprehensive activities that connect multiple services, programs, or systems?
Notes: 1 = Extremely well; 2 = Very well; 3 = Somewhat well; 4 = Not so well; 5 = Not well at all

ElementDescription: By working together, how well are these partners able to clearly communicate to people in the community how the partnership's actions will address problems that are important to them?
Notes: 1 = Extremely well; 2 = Very well; 3 = Somewhat well; 4 = Not so well; 5 = Not well at all

ElementDescription: Please think about all of the people who provide either formal or informal leadership in this partnership and rate their total effectiveness in each of the following areas: Take responsibility for the partnership

ElementDescription: Please choose the statement that best describes how well your partnership uses the partners' financial resources.
Notes: 1= Makes excellent use of resources; 2 = Makes very good use of resources; 3 = Makes good use of resources; 4 = Makes fair use of resources; 5 = Makes poor use of resources

ElementDescription: Please think about the administrative and management activities in your partnership and rate its effectiveness in carrying out each of the following activities: Coordinating communication among partners

ElementDescription: A partnership needs non-financial resources in order to work effectively and achieve its goals. For each of the following types of resources, to what extent does your partnership have what it needs to work effectively?- Skills and expertise (e.g., leadership, administration, evaluation, law, public policy, cultural competency, training, community organizing)
Notes: 1=A great deal; 2=Moderately; 3=Quite a bit; 4=Somewhat; 5=A little; 6=Not at all

ElementDescription: A partnership needs non-financial resources in order to work effectively and achieve its goals. For each of the following types of resources, to what extent does your partnership have what it needs to work effectively?- Data and information (e.g., statistical data, information about community perceptions, values, resources, and politics)

ElementDescription: How comfortable are you with the way decisions are made in the partnership?
Notes: 1 = Extremely comfortable; 2 = Very comfortable; 3 = Somewhat comfortable; 4 = A little comfortable; 5 = Not at all comfortable

ElementDescription: How often do you support the decisions made by the partnership?
Notes: 1= Never/almost never; 2= Seldom; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often; 5= Always

ElementDescription: How often do you feel that you have been left out of the decision making process?
Notes: 1= Never/almost never; 2= Seldom; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often; 5= Always

ElementDescription: For each of the following benefits, please indicate whether you have or have not received the benefit as a result of participating in the partnership- Enhanced ability to address an important issue
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: For each of the following benefits, please indicate whether you have or have not received the benefit as a result of participating in the partnership- Development of new skills
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: For each of the following benefits, please indicate whether you have or have not received the benefit as a result of participating in the partnership- Heightened public profile
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: For each of the following benefits, please indicate whether you have or have not received the benefit as a result of participating in the partnership- Increased utilization of my expertise or services
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: For each of the following benefits, please indicate whether you have or have not received the benefit as a result of participating in the partnership- Acquisition of useful knowledge about services, programs, or people in the community
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: For each of the following benefits, please indicate whether you have or have not received the benefit as a result of participating in the partnership- Enhanced ability to affect public policy
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: For each of the following benefits, please indicate whether you have or have not received the benefit as a result of participating in the partnership- Development of valuable relationships
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: As a result of your participation in the partnership, have you experienced the following benefits?: Enhanced ability to meet the needs of my constituency or clients
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: As a result of your participation in the partnership, have you experienced the following benefits?: Ability to have a greater impact than I could have on my own
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: For each of the following drawbacks, please indicate whether or not you have or have not experienced the drawback as a result of participating in this partnership- Ability to make a contribution to the community
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: For each of the following drawbacks, please indicate whether or not you have or have not experienced the drawback as a result of participating in this partnership- Acquisition of additional financial support
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: For each of the following drawbacks, please indicate whether or not you have or have not experienced the drawback as a result of participating in this partnership- Diversion of time and resources away from other priorities or obligations
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: For each of the following drawbacks, please indicate whether or not you have or have not experienced the drawback as a result of participating in this partnership- Insufficient influence in partnership activities
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: For each of the following drawbacks, please indicate whether or not you have or have not experienced the drawback as a result of participating in this partnership- Viewed negatively due to association with other partners or the partnership
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: For each of the following drawbacks, please indicate whether or not you have or have not experienced the drawback as a result of participating in this partnership- Frustration or aggravation
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: For each of the following drawbacks, please indicate whether or not you have or have not experienced the drawback as a result of participating in this partnership- Insufficient credit given to me for contributing to the accomplishments of the partnership
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: For each of the following drawbacks, please indicate whether or not you have or have not experienced the drawback as a result of participating in this partnership- Conflict between my job and the partnership's work
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No

ElementDescription: So far, how have the benefits of participating in this partnership compared to the drawbacks?
Notes: 1 = Benefits greatly exceed drawbacks; 2 = Benefits exceed drawbacks; 3 = Benefits and drawbacks about equal; 4 = Drawbacks exceed the benefits; 5 = Drawbacks greatly exceed the benefits

ElementDescription: How satisfied are you with the way the people and organizations in the partnership work together?
Notes: 1 = Completely satisfied; 2 = Mostly satisfied; 3 = Somewhat satisfied; 4 = A little satisfied; 5 = Not at all satisfied

ElementDescription: How satisfied are you with your influence in the partnership?
Notes: 1 = Completely satisfied; 2 = Mostly satisfied; 3 = Somewhat satisfied; 4 = A little satisfied; 5 = Not at all satisfied

ElementDescription: How satisfied are you with your role in the partnership?
Notes: 1 = Completely satisfied; 2 = Mostly satisfied; 3 = Somewhat satisfied; 4 = A little satisfied; 5 = Not at all satisfied

ElementDescription: How satisfied are you with the partnership's plans for achieving its goals?
Notes: 1 = Completely satisfied; 2 = Mostly satisfied; 3 = Somewhat satisfied; 4 = A little satisfied; 5 = Not at all satisfied

ElementDescription: How satisfied are you with the way the partnership is implementing its plans?
Notes: 1 = Completely satisfied; 2 = Mostly satisfied; 3 = Somewhat satisfied; 4 = A little satisfied; 5 = Not at all satisfied
